business.headline: Sensex, Nifty tumble ahead of US elections; Hero MotoCorp falls 4%The NSE Nifty 50 dropped by 321.20 points to settle at 23,983.15, while the BSE Sensex fell 941.88 points to 78,782.24. Most of the broader market indices also declined sharply during the session.

Donald Trump vs Kamala Harris: How US elections may impact Indian stock marketWith the US election just a day away, Indian markets prepare for shifts across sectors from tech to oil. What could this high-stakes race mean for investors on Dalal Street?

Stock market crash: Adani Ports, Reliance, Bajaj Auto among top losers Market crash: The bloodbath on Dalal Street can be attributed to a combination of factors, including a disappointing Q2 earnings season, heightened caution ahead of the upcoming US presidential elections, and persistent selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs).
US presidential elections cause market turbulence as investors grow waryThe US elections are affecting the share market, with significant impacts on bond yields and investor caution.

At 12:57 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,303.19 points at 78,420.93, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 437.15 points to trade at 23,867.20.

Explained: How Adani Power's supply cut impacts crisis-hit Bangladesh economyAdani Power's supply cut to Bangladesh intensifies existing economic challenges, raising concerns about energy security and financial stability.

Adani Power cuts half of Bangladesh electricity supply over unpaid duesThe power reduction comes at a challenging time for Bangladesh, which reported a shortfall of over 1,600 megawatts (MW) overnight. The 1,496 MW Adani plant is currently generating just 700 MW from one of its two units.

Muhurat Trading 2024: Markets end on strong note; all sectoral indices in greenMuhurat Trading 2024 has concluded, marking the arrival of Samvat 2081. The session, which took place from 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM, ended on a strong note, with the Sensex surging 335 points and the Nifty closing at 24,300. Investors actively participated, reflecting the festive spirit of the Hindu New Year through token investments aimed at attracting prosperity. All the sectoral indices ended the session in green, with M&M, ONGC, Adani Ports and BEL emerging as the top gainers. On the other hand, the top losers were Dr Reddy's, HCLTech, Britannia, Tech Mahindra and Adani Enterprises.

Muhurat Trading 2024: Check timings, stock recommendations, all key detailsMuhurat Trading today: The pre-opening session will begin at 5:45 PM, and all intraday positions will be automatically squared off 15 minutes before the session's close, necessitating careful planning for same-day trades.

Muhurat trading 2024: Check stock picks, trading strategy and expert insightsMuhurat trading is not just a unique market session; it's a cherished tradition where investors make token investments to invoke the blessings of Goddess Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Expect separatists will be punished: India on Hindu temple attack in CanadaExpect separatists indulging in violence will be prosecuted: India to Canada on temple attack

Cracker ban was hardly implemented: Supreme Court in notice to Delhi top copThe Supreme Court has asked the Delhi Police Commissioner to submit an affidavit on steps taken by police to ensure a complete firecrackers ban within a week.

Why mum on Khalistanis? Trudeau, Hindu minister questioned after temple attackThe world saw that a pro-Khalistani mob attacked devotees on the premises of a Hindu temple in Brampton, Canada. As Canadian leaders, including Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and a Hindu minister of his Cabinet, condemned the attack, they remained silent on the attackers. Their silence is being questioned now.

36 killed as bus falls into Uttarakhand gorge, Rs 4 lakh aid announcedUttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has announced financial assistance of Rs 4 lakh each for the families of the deceased and Rs 1 lakh each for the injured.

Chaos in J&K Assembly over resolution against Article 370 abrogationPDP MLA Waheed Para, who represents the Pulwama Assembly seat, submitted the resolution to newly-elected Speaker, Abdul Rahim Rather and called for an urgent discussion during the five-day session, despite not being a part of the agenda.

Maharashtra top cop, accused of phone-tapping by Congress, transferredMaharashtra Congress president Nana Patole had written to Rajiv Kumar on October 31, requesitng him to remove Rashmi Shukla from her position and had accused her of displaying a "clear bias" against opposition parties in the state.

Shah Rukh Khan says he's not a role model for quitting smokingShah Rukh Khan recently stated that he shouldn't be considered a role model for quitting smoking, as he smoked for 30 years before giving it up.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Batenge to katenge echoes in Canada after temple attack'Batenge to katenge', a slogan urging Hindus to unite, is now echoing in Canada. The priest of the Brampton temple, where a pro-Khalistani mob attacked devotees, has used the slogan to ask Hindus to forgo differences and stand united. The slogan was popularised by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath.
Bypolls in Kerala, Punjab, and Uttar Pradesh rescheduled for November 20The Election Commission has postponed the bypolls in Kerala, Punjab, and Uttar Pradesh to November 20 from November 13.

Why US is going nuts over killing of celebrity squirrel ahead of pollsWith the US set to go to the polls on November 5, the death of internet sensation Peanut the squirrel has become the latest flashpoint between the Republicans and Democrats.

Video: Devotees at Mathura temple mistake AC water for 'charan amrit', drink itThe videos show many devotees raising their hands to the elephant sculpture to collect the water. Some of them were even seen with paper cups, collecting the water which they thought was coming straight from the feet of the deities inside the temple.

Spooked by turn: Once India's strength, spin is now their kryptoniteIndia vs New Zealand: Indian batters can no longer dominate spin. By preparing rank-turners, India have been shooting themselves in their foot. The 0-3 humiliation in the recently-concluded home Test series raises concerning questions.

Australia survive fiery Pakistan pace battery to win Melbourne ODI AUS vs PAK: Pat Cummins' Australia survived a burst from the Pakistani pace attack and won the Melbourne ODI by two wickets on Monday, thereby taking a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.

How a war 4,000km afar is fuelling a farm fire in HaryanaA war 4,000 kilometres away has got farmers in several districts of Haryana protesting. It is because of the Israel-Hamas war and its ripple effects on the Red Sea routes that has resulted in a big shortage of di-ammonium phosphate (DAP), a crucial fertiliser, before sowing of Rabi crops.
Chinese spacecraft makes fiery re-entry into Earth, breaks apartDespite this intense descent, the crew landed safely in the Dongfeng area near Jiuquan Spaceport.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
